item.title: Inside Front Garden 67 Gaisford St Council Property, 20th January
item.description:
Tenant reports that a notice has been put on the Palm Tree in the front garden to be removed because its being deemed “dead, dying or hazardous”
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Gaisford Street, Kentish Town, Greater London

item.title: Huge adverts posted on hoarding, 20th January
item.description:
The site for building a care home in Danson Road has been abandoned as the company has run out of money. The hoarding around the site has deteriorated over 3 years and now this. Pavilion patios have posted 2 huge posters advertising their company. This has nothing to do with the site. This is opposite my house and I’d like them taken down. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Road, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox in car park behind block of flats (Ballard Court), 20th January
item.description:

item.title: Leaves on Hassendean Road, 20th January
item.description:
Council workers cleaned up leaves last week and left them outside my house a week ago. Binmen have been and not collected them.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hassendean Road, Blackheath
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several household items dumped on the pavement, 20th January
item.description:
Another incident of 75 Finsbury Park Road dumping household items on to pavement outside. Several items have been fly tipped and left for over a week. This is the third occasion this household has dumped items in the street within the last month.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Finsbury Park Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping box of 5 full canisters of Nitrous Oxide (Magic whip), 20th January
item.description:
Area at rear gate to Ducks infant school. A box containing at least 5 full canisters of Nitrous Oxide (Magic Whip). I have previously seen balloons and empty canisters in the area. Possibly being used by those abusing Nitrous Oxide although I have never seen anyone in the vacinity. Remains of chair from previous Flytipping still there. Noticed several days ago.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grange Lane, Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 6 black bin bags containing leaves abandoned., 20th January
item.description:
About 3 weeks ago the council collected a load of leaves and put them in 6 bin bags outside 1 McCall Crescent. Any danger of you coming and collecting them. They’re causing an obstruction on the footpath.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mccall Crescent, Charlton
